Definition.WordDefinition:
Segregation \Seg`re*ga"tion\, n. [L. segregatio: cf. F. s['e]gr['e]gation.] 1. The act of segregating, or the state of being segregated; separation from others; a parting. [1913 Webster]
2. (Geol.) Separation from a mass, and gathering about centers or into cavities at hand through cohesive attraction or the crystallizing process. [1913 Webster]

segregation n 1: (genetics) the separation of paired alleles during meiosis so that members of each pair of alleles appear in different gametes 2: a social system that provides separate facilities for minority groups [syn: {separatism}] 3: the act of segregating or sequestering; "sequestration of the jury" [syn: {sequestration}] [ant: {integration}]
